5.2. Autoregressive Methods 33
not support seasonal data. That is a time series with a repeating cycle. ARIMA expects data
that is either not seasonal or has the seasonal component removed, e.g. seasonally adjusted via
methods such as seasonal diﬀerencing.
A linear regression model is constructed including the speciﬁed number and type of terms,
and the data is prepared by a degree of diﬀerencing in order to make it stationary, i.e. to
